title: How to learn Flask
content: Flask Flask logo.svg Developer(s) Armin Ronacher Initial release April 1, 2010; 12 years ago Stable release  2.2.2[1] Edit this on Wikidata / 9 August 2022; 2 months ago Repository github.com/pallets/flask Written in Python Type Web framework License BSD Website palletsprojects.com/p/flask/ Flask is a micro web framework written in Python. It is classified as a microframework because it does not require particular tools or libraries.[2] It has no database abstraction layer, form validation, or any other components where pre-existing third-party libraries provide common functions. However, Flask supports extensions that can add application features as if they were implemented in Flask itself. Extensions exist for object-relational mappers, form validation, upload handling, various open authentication technologies and several common framework related tools.[3]  Applications that use the Flask framework include Pinterest and LinkedIn.
